generif.text: Intermedin is a calcitonin/calcitonin gene-related peptide family peptide acting through the calcitonin receptor-like receptor/receptor activity-modifying protein receptor complexes
ADM2 may be related to the central and peripheral regulation of the circulation and water-electrolyte metabolism
IMD expressed by pericytes in has a role in susceptibility of the skin of atopic dermatitis patients to inflammatory stimuli

Study has shown expression of AM2/IMD in various types of cells in the central nervous system and the cardiovascular system, and suggested possible (patho)physiological roles of AM2/IMD in these systems.

robust increase in expression of the peptide in hypertrophied and ischaemic myocardium indicates an important protective role for adrenomedullin 2 as an endogenous counter-regulatory peptide in the heart--REVIEW
adrenomedullin 2/intermedin may have autocrine/paracrine regulatory roles in adrenal tumors and attached non-neoplastic adrenal tissues, such as tumor growth.
Vascular injury in rat kidney is reduced by IMD gene delivery and it prevents glomerular and peritubular capillary loss.
Data show that adrenomedullin-2 was shown to be secreted by HAEC and may play a potential protective role in human aortic endothelial cells.
may have a role in the physiology of human pregnancy via regulation of trophoblast invasion and migration
IMD enhances angiogenesis through ERK, Akt/NOS/NO, and VEGF/VEGFR-2 signaling pathways
IMD is a novel hypoxia-induced gene and a potential interventional agent for the improvement of endothelial barrier function in systemic inflammatory responses and hypoxia-induced vascular leakage.
IMD may be an endogenous vasoprotective factor for vascular calcification
potentially involved in regulating HLA-G antigen at the maternal-fetal interface and facilitating trophoblast invasion and migration via MAPK3/1 phosphorylation
Intermedin reduces HUVEC permeability via Rac1-mediated actin cytoskeleton rearrangement.
adm2 polymorphism is associated with renal dysfunction, blood pressure regulation and asymptomatic cerebrovascular diseases in the Japanese general population

Adrenomedullin-related peptide, AM2 was highly expressed in colorectal cancer tissue. The percent increase of AM2 synthesis in cancer tissues to the surrounding normal tissues was greater than adrenomedullin.

Data showed that intermedin (IMD)/adrenomedullin 2 (ADM2) is a novel oocyte-derived ligand important for the regulation of cell interactions in COCs that functions, in part, by suppressing cumulus cell apoptosis.
Intermedin plays a critical role in the vascular remodeling process and tumor angiogenesis by regulating vascular endothelial-cadherin and extracellular signal-regulated kinase.
this study is the first to demonstrate a potential involvement of IMD in human embryo implantation and placental development via regulation of trophoblast invasion at the maternal-fetal interface
Plasma intermedin and BNP levels were markedly higher in acute coronary syndrome patients than in healthy people.

a significant increase in plasma intermedin following acute myocardial infarction may be associated with oxidative stress, and could be used as a marker to reflect the severity of the coronary stenosis
ADM and IMD mRNA expression are elevated in chronic heart failure at different stages of the disease.
results suggest that high plasma intermedin level is associated with poor outcomes of patients and may be a useful prognostic biomarker in ST-segment elevation acute myocardial infarction.
TSH induced AM2/IMD expression in the thyroid gland and it could locally work as a potent vasodilator, resulting in the expansion of thyroid inter-follicular capillaries.
Intermedin affects the endothelial cell junction and blood vessel sprouting in a VE-cadherin dependent way.
High levels of ADM2 expression predict a poorer survival in patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
Elevated plasma intermedin levels are independently associated with long-term recurrence and distant metastasis of prostate cancer.
ADM2 may contribute to the physiology of embryo implantation and placental growth via increasing MMP2 and decreasing MUC1 expression to facilitate trophoblast invasion.

Intermedin (IMD) derived from human cardiac microvascular endothelial cell and acting in a paracrine manner on cardiomyocytes, predominantly at AM1 receptors, is more likely to contribute to direct protection by endogenous IMD of cardiomyocytes against acute ischemia reperfusion injury.
Intermedin1-53 may attenuate vascular calcification by upregulating alpha-Klotho via the calcitonin receptor/modifying protein complex and protein kinase A signaling.
ADM-2 is a stress-inducible gene controlled by ATF-4.

Mouse and human heart valves expressed mRNAs for the CRL ligands adrenomedullin (AM), adrenomedullin-2 (AM-2) and calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) and for their receptor components, i.e., CRL and receptor-activity-modifying proteins 1-3.
The plasma ADM2 levels were inversely correlated with obesity in humans, and adipo-ADM2-transgenic (tg) mice displayed resistance to high-fat diet-induced obesity with increased energy expenditure.
IMD may be an important self-protective factor in response to sepsis.
Intermedin binds the RAMP1/CLR complex via a triple beta-turn.

Study revealed that exogenous intermedin up-regulates the expression of VEGF and RAMP2 at least partially via activating Wnt/beta-catenin signaling, finally promoting angiogenesis of hypoxia and reoxygenation impaired HUVECs in vitro.
Consistent with this hypothesis, we showed that acylated truncated ADM/ADM2 analogs of 27-31 residues exhibit potent antagonistic activity toward CLR/RAMP1 and 2.

AM2 signaling is suppressed in adipose tissue in obesity, involving lower receptor expression and ligand availability, likely contributing to insulin resistance and other aspects of the pathophysiology associated with obesity.
Protective effects of intermedin/adrenomedullin-2 in a cellular model of human pulmonary arterial hypertension.
Intermedin alleviates the inflammatory response and stabilizes the endothelial barrier in LPS-induced ARDS through the PI3K/Akt/eNOS signaling pathway.
Altered expression of ADM and ADM2 by hypoxia regulates migration of trophoblast and HLA-G expressiondagger.
Intermedin facilitates hepatocellular carcinoma cell survival and invasion via ERK1/2-EGR1/DDIT3 signaling cascade.
Inhibition of Notch1-mediated inflammation by intermedin protects against abdominal aortic aneurysm via PI3K/Akt signaling pathway.
CGRP, adrenomedullin and adrenomedullin 2 display endogenous GPCR agonist bias in primary human cardiovascular cells.
Study on Protection of Human Umbilical Vein Endothelial Cells from Amiodarone-Induced Damage by Intermedin through Activation of Wnt/beta-Catenin Signaling Pathway.
CRIF1 deficiency suppresses endothelial cell migration via upregulation of RhoGDI2.
Intermedin (adrenomedullin 2) promotes breast cancer metastasis via Src/c-Myc-mediated ribosome production and protein translation.
Adrenomedullin 2/intermedin is a slow off-rate, long-acting endogenous agonist of the adrenomedullin2 G protein-coupled receptor.
Intermedin alleviates diabetic vascular calcification by inhibiting GLUT1 through activation of the cAMP/PKA signaling pathway.
Reduced PATL2 Impairs the Proliferation of Ovarian Granulosa Cells by Decreasing ADM2 Expression in Patients with PCOS.
Calcitonin gene-related peptide and intermedin induce phosphorylation of p44/42 MAPK in primary human lymphatic endothelial cells in vitro.

BP.term: regulation of systemic arterial blood pressure
adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway

name: adrenomedullin 2
summary: This gene encodes a member of the calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP)/calcitonin family of hormones that play a role in the regulation of cardiovascular homeostasis, prolactin release, anti-diuresis, anti-natriuresis, and regulation of food and water intake. The encoded protein is proteolytically processed to generate one or more biologically active peptides. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2015].
